adqs.title: Average Daily Quantities (ADQ)
adqs.description: An ADQ is how much of the active ingredient in the drug a patient would take per day, on average.  This is useful because the prescribing data tells you how many pills were prescribed, but not how many patients were taking the drug.
adqs.notes: Source is data provided privately by HSCIC, extracted from ePACT in April 2016. Not all presentations are included. Their ref NIC-23748-Q0D1L enquiries@hscic.gov.uk. We should refresh this approx yearly.

bnf_codes.title: Human readable terms for BNF prescription codes
bnf_codes.description: Every row of prescribing data has a `presentation` field, a 15 character code that encodes the chemical, a classification, and its formulation (e.g. 5ml per 100ml solution, etc). The BNF codes allow us to decode the presentation.

ccg_boundaries.title: Boundaries of CCGs in mapinfo format
ccg_boundaries.notes: Currently using version as of April 2017. If a new version of this file is found by the pipeline, the importer for this will fail without custom intervention; see the comments in the file (`import_ccg_boundaries`) for more info and carry out these steps before continuing.

ccg_details.title: Addresses and dates for CCGs
ccg_details.description: The definitive source of NHS organisational data
ccg_details.notes: Quarterly and monthly diffs are also available

dispensing_practices.title: List of dispensing practices, addresses, and GP counts
dispensing_practices.description: A Dispensing Practice has the authority to dispense as well as prescribe drugs, on the grounds they are very rural. There are a bit over 1000 in England.

dmd.title: Dictionary of medicines and devices (dm+d)
dmd.description: The dm+d is a dictionary of descriptions and codes which represent medicines and devices in use across the NHS.
dmd.notes: Run `./manage.py fetch_dmd {year} {month}` and follow the instructions.

dmd_snomed.title: Mapping of SNOMED to BNF codes
dmd_snomed.description: This mapping is supplied privately via email (web version promised repeatedly).
dmd_snomed.publication_schedule: approximately monthly, or when they get back to us
dmd_snomed.notes: Current contact is Margaret Dockey; the file to ask for is the BNF/SNOMED mapping. Seb has email threads that can be followed up

nhs_payments_to_general_practice.title: Summary of annual payments by NHS to GPs
nhs_payments_to_general_practice.description: Payments are broken down by category, The formula for working out payments is based on a weighted patient list size, which we might find useful. It is calculated as per the [GP Contract](http://systems.hscic.gov.uk/ssd/downloads/newgpcontractpay/ngms-contents/appaglobalsum#CalcPracPCOWeightedListsize), and factors in Age/Sex, Additional Needs, Turnover, Market Forces, Rurality, and Nursing/Residential homes.
nhs_payments_to_general_practice.notes: The 2013/14 version was described as 'experimental'. I'm not sure if this has ever been used, so tagged as `research`

nhs_postcode_file.title: NHS postcodes with geography data
nhs_postcode_file.description: Data originating with ONS for NHS-related postcodes, including ONS census districts, etc, and most importantly georeferences
licence_attributions: Contains OS data © Crown copyright and database right <year>
Contains Royal Mail data © Royal Mail copyright and Database right <year>
Contains National Statistics data © Crown copyright and database right <year>

patient_list_size.title: Patient list sizes of practice broken down by age decile and gender
patient_list_size.notes: The data doesn't contain date stamps, so we rely on the correct datestamping of the containing folder to verify the validity of the data. For example, if a CSV is valid for Jan - March 2016, then it should be placed in a folder like `2016_03/patient_list_size_new.csv`

patient_list_weightings.title: ASTRO-PU and STAR-PU weightings
patient_list_weightings.description: When comparing between practices, it is common to calculate cost per patient (for example). However, different demographics have different needs and may be lumpily represented for particular practices. Weightings are used to correct for this.
patient_list_weightings.notes: The importer actually dumps values to JSON, rather than importing. This json is then saved to the PracticeStatistics model whenever tha model is saved, which in practice is whenever the `import_list_sizes` importer is run.

practice_details.title: Addresses and dates for GP Practices
practice_details.description: The definitive source of NHS organisational data: includes practice setting and practice-CCG membership
practice_details.notes: Quarterly and monthly diffs are also available

prescribing.title: GP Practice Prescribing
prescribing.description: General practice prescribing data is a list of all medicines, dressings and appliances that are prescribed and dispensed each month.
prescribing.notes: Run `./manage.py fetch_prescribing_data {year} {month}` and follow the instructions.

prescribing_metadata.title: GP Practice Prescribing metadata
prescribing_metadata.description: Metadata for joining with prescribing data

qof.title: The Quality and Outcomes Framework (QOF) is the annual reward and incentive programme for GPs
qof.description: The incentives are based on prevalence of certain conditions, and the data is presented at various output levels, including practice and CCG. It runs across a financial year (i.e. April - March)
